abstract: David Carr Media Equation column welcomes Occupied Wall Street Journal, free, professionally produced four-page, full-color newspaper, which has gained surprising traction as tool of protest at Occupy Wall Street rallies in Manhattan; finds it reassuring that a newspaper still has traction in an environment preoccupied by social media.
snippet: Even in an environment preoccupied with digital media, a newspaper has gained traction as a tool of protest at the Occupy Wall Street rallies.
lead_paragraph: Even in an environment preoccupied with digital media, a newspaper has gained traction as a tool of protest at the Occupy Wall Street rallies.

headline.seo: Wall Street Protesters Have Ink-Stained Fingers
